data.title: Wren Expands Executive Management Team to Support Growing Atlanta Presence

data.text:
ATLANTA, Jan. 18, 2012 /PRNewswire/ -- Wren Solutions, a leading loss-prevention technology provider, today announced the appointments of Amelia Fusaro as president and chief operating officer, and Mark Lummus as vice president of operations. The appointments of Fusaro and Lummus bring further depth and breadth of experience to Wren's management team as the Company intensifies its growth and focus on product development and general operations in its Atlanta offices.

Amelia Fusaro brings more than two decades of experience in developing growth strategies for emerging technology companies to her new role as Wren's president and chief operating officer.

Mark Lummus, in his position as Wren's vice president of operations, leverages more than 25 years of experience in the creation of large-scale technology solutions for global markets. Both positions are based in Atlanta, which is also home to the company's sales, marketing and software research and development functions.

"While we're headquartered in Missouri, Atlanta is key to our strategy moving forward," said CEO Andrew Wren. "We continue to solidify our role as the leading provider of cutting-edge technology that helps retailers reduce loss and manage operational risk, and Atlanta offers the talent pool we need to further our growth. Amelia and Mark are fantastic additions to our management team and represent our focus on product management and development."

As President and COO, Amelia Fusaro leverages her successful business leadership and market development experience as she directs the execution of Wren's corporate strategy to increase market share, revenues and brand recognition. Fusaro comes to Wren following 11 years as a strategic business advisor to numerous emerging technology companies, including Wren. Prior to her consulting business, Fusaro served as vice president of marketing for Technologic, Inc., an Internet security company acquired by eSoft. Fusaro has a Bachelor of Science degree in Cognitive Science from Furman University in Greenville, South Carolina.

As vice president of operations, Mark Lummus directs all activities related to product development, services and support of Wren's security technology solutions. He has led many large-scale development efforts that produced commercially successful products and is experienced at executing strategic partnerships with global companies. Lummus most recently served as senior R&D line manager at Nokia, and before that as senior product manager at Intellisync Corporation. He previously founded two technology companies, including venture-backed AppForge, and created award-winning products recognized by eWeek, CNET, and PC Magazine. Lummus graduated from Georgia Institute of Technology with a Bachelor of Science in Information and Computer Science.

About Wren

For nearly 30 years, Wren Solutions has served leading retailers with technologies that help loss prevention professionals reduce loss, increase profits and rise as heroes in their companies. The company's solutions, including enterprise-class video management software, access control systems, loss prevention and operational assessments, surveillance cameras and hardware, and professional services, enable retail organizations to lower shrink and protect people, assets and facilities, while empowering them with operational insights for better performance. Established in 1983 and headquartered in Jefferson City, MO, Wren is a member of the Food Marketing Institute (FMI), the Loss Prevention Research Council (LPRC), the National Retail Federation (NRF) and the Retail Industry Leaders Association (RILA).
